article.headline: Mercer 74, North Florida 55
article.story: MACON, Ga. -- James Florence scored 24 points, leading four Mercer players in double digits in a 74-55 win over North Florida on Monday night. Daniel Emerson scored 14 points and grabbed 14 boards for the Bears (14-11, 8-6 Atlantic Sun Conference). E.J. Kusnyer added 12 points and Brian Mills had 10. Kusnyer was 4-for-8 from beyond the arc, and Mills was 2-for-3 from long range. Eni Cuka led the Ospreys (5-19, 3-11) with 23 points and Cortez Riley added 10. Mercer led by eight points at the break and outscored UNF 44-33 in the second half to seal the win. The home team shot a blistering 81.3 percent from the field (13 of 16) in the final period. The Bears, who won the rebounding battle 37-21, have won three straight games. UNF has lost three in a row.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
